title: The new Frankel? Pinatubo shows another side as he defies soft ground to make it six from six with Newmarket win
text:
It was rain, ultimately, that brought down Enable in last week’s Prix de L’Arc de Triomphe but soft ground was not enough to stop racing’s latest poster-horse Pinatubo being crowned champion two-year-old after the Godolphin colt made it six wins from six starts in the Darley Dewhurst Stakes on Saturday.

It is unlikely his rating – already higher than Frankel’s at the same age and only bettered by Celtic Swing – earned when he won the National Stakes by nine lengths, will be raised for the two-length victory over Arizona and, in all probability, he had already done enough to win the title “champion” whatever the outcome.

But unbeaten in a racehorse – as Frankel was at the end of his career – carries great cachet and it will not just be Godolphin but racing which hopes he can carry on where he left off next season. He is already even money for the 2,000 Guineas in May.

After a series of wide-margin wins on good ground the imperturbable colt, who shows very little at home but clearly saves his best for the racecourse, had to show something else on the soft ground and in a race which his jockey, William Buick, described as a “war of attrition”.
description: It was rain, ultimately, that brought down Enable in last week’s Prix de L’Arc de Triomphe but soft ground was not enough to stop racing’s latest poster-horse Pinatubo being crowned champion two-year-old after the Godolphin colt made it six wins from six starts in the Darley Dewhurst Stakes on Saturday.
